com.paulmender.udacity.popularmovies.widget

Class MovieDbRecyclerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<MovieDbRecyclerAdapter.MovieDbViewHolder>
      • com.paulmender.udacity.popularmovies.widget.MovieDbRecyclerAdapter

  • public class MovieDbRecyclerAdapter
extends RecyclerView.Adapter<MovieDbRecyclerAdapter.MovieDbViewHolder>
    Package: com.paulmender.udacity.popularmovies.widget Project: PopularMovies Name: MovieDbRecyclerAdapter Purpose: Adapters provide a binding from an app-specific data set to views that are displayed within a RecyclerView (1). References: 1. https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v7/widget/RecyclerView.Adapter.html 2. https://guides.codepath.com/android/using-the-recyclerview#creating-the-recyclerview-adapter. 3. https://guides.codepath.com/android/Heterogenous-Layouts-inside-RecyclerView 4. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27809524/recyclerview-not-call-oncreateviewholder answered Jan 7 '15 at 0:24, Konstantin Burov. History: 20171118 Implement heterogeneous layouts for Stage 2. 20171208 Renamed setMovieData to setData. Refactor MovieDbAdapterOnClickHandler to MovieDbAdapterOnClickHandler.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public MovieDbRecyclerAdapter.MovieDbViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(ViewGroup viewGroup,
                                                                   int viewType)
        This gets called when each new ViewHolder is created. This happens when the RecyclerView is laid out. Enough ViewHolders will be created to fill the screen and allow for scrolling.
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class RecyclerView.Adapter<MovieDbRecyclerAdapter.MovieDbViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        viewGroup - The ViewGroup that these ViewHolders are contained within.
        viewType - Note: If the RecyclerView has more than one type of item, use this viewType integer to provide a different layout. See RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int) for more details.
        Returns:
        A new MovieDbViewHolder that holds the View for each movie poster item.

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(MovieDbRecyclerAdapter.MovieDbViewHolder movieDbViewHolder,
                             int position)
        OnBindViewHolder is called by the RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. Update the contents of the ViewHolder to display the movie for this particular position.
        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class RecyclerView.Adapter<MovieDbRecyclerAdapter.MovieDbViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        movieDbViewHolder - The ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        position - The position of the item within the adapter's data set.

      • setData

        public void setData(List<? extends Parcelable> parcelables,
                    int selectedItemId)
        Purpose: This method is used to set the parcelables data if the RecyclerAdapter already exists. This allows a new data query without the need to create a new RecyclerAdapter to display it. (1) History: 20171222 Confirmed: Always notify data set changed regardless of list size. References: 1. Udacity S03.01-Solution-RecyclerView.
        Parameters:
        parcelables - The new movies to be displayed.
